definition: to go to school/to attend school
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: I asked my colleague you in that school? He said that in.
sentences.chinese: 我問我同事你在那上學呢？他說在，電大。

sentences.english: He cheerfully went off to school.
sentences.chinese: 他高高興興地上學去了。

sentences.english: I doubt an opportunity like this, for unschooling, will come again soon.
sentences.chinese: 對不上學來說，這樣的機會不會太多。

sentences.english: Metaphysic is the finding of bad reasons for what we believe on instinct.
sentences.chinese: 形而上學是我們爲相信直覺而找到的壞理由。

sentences.english: You came late to class, so you're not seeing the whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 你上學遲到了，以是你沒有瞅見工作的全數顛末。

sentences.english: On my first day of school, I didn't speak a word of English.
sentences.chinese: 當我第一天上學時，我連一個英文單詞都說不出口。

sentences.english: Ann apologized to her teacher for coming to school late.
sentences.chinese: 安因上學遲到而向老師道歉。

sentences.english: He will go to clown school.
I study in Luohu Foreign Language School.
sentences.chinese: 我在羅湖外國語學校上學。

sentences.english: Yang Hao goes to school to get knowledge about farming in Beijiang.
sentences.chinese: 楊浩上學是爲了得到農業方面的知識。

sentences.english: Hey,my sweetheart,time to get up for school.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，寶貝兒，該起牀上學了。

sentences.english: He (was selected ) the monitor when he was at school.
sentences.chinese: 他在上學時被選爲班長。

sentences.english: Sometimes I go to educate by bike and at whiles on foot.
sentences.chinese: 我有時騎自行車上學，有時步行去。

sentences.english: I'm studying at Qihang bilingual school, in Class 2, Grade 4.
sentences.chinese: 我住在仙河鎮，我在啓航雙語學校四年級二班上學。

sentences.english: In criticizing and transcending over traditional metaphysics, Heidegger and Whitehead adopted different approaches but yielded the same excellent results.
sentences.chinese: 二者對傳統形而上學的批判與超越具有異工同曲之妙。

sentences.english: They choose if you go to school or stay home.
sentences.chinese: 他們選擇你是否去上學或待在家裏。

definition: to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to read a book/to study/to attend school
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
